js
Class JSNotification

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      js.JSNotification
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class JSNotification
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.beans.PropertyChangeListener

JSNotification provides a way to display a small notification on screen with a title and short paragraph of text. It is inspired by the Growl framework for OS X.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

JSNotification

public JSNotification(java.lang.String text)
Creates a new notification with no title, no image and the specified text.

Parameters:
text - the text to display in the body of the notification.

JSNotification

public JSNotification(java.lang.String title,
                      java.lang.String text)
Creates a new notification with the specified title, no image and the specified text.

Parameters:
title - the text to display at the top of the notification.
text - the text to display in the body of the notification.

JSNotification

public JSNotification(java.lang.String title,
                      java.lang.String text,
                      javax.swing.ImageIcon icon)
Creates a new notification with the specified title, specified image and specified text.

Parameters:
title - the text to display at the top of the notification.
text - the text to display in the body of the notification.
icon - the image to display on the left hand side of the notification.
Method Detail

setLocationOnScreen

public void setLocationOnScreen(int location)
Sets which corner of the screen the notification should be displayed in.

To use this method, pass one of the JSNotification location constants such as JSNotification.LEFT or JSNotification.BOTTOM_RIGHT.

Parameters:
location - the integer representing the corner of the screen to display the notification in.

setDisplayDuration

public void setDisplayDuration(int duration)
Sets the duration in seconds that the notification should be displayed for when using the display() method.

Parameters:
duration - the time in seconds to display the notification for.

display

public void display()
Makes the notification visible on screen and automatically hides it again once the specified duration has passed.

displayForDuration

public void displayForDuration(int duration)
Performs the same action as display() but without having to call setDisplayDuration() first.

Parameters:
duration - the duration in seconds to display the notification for.
